messages.msg: Operation has beed cancelled by user.

The program is designed for parallel download files from multiple mirrors. Supported protocols: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP.
Usage:
{} [ARGUMENTS...] LINKS...
Arguments:
-h Show this help. --help
-v Show version. --version
-b block_size Specify the size of data block received from mirrors in each task. Default value is 4MB. --block-size=block_size Value could be in bytes, kilobytes or megabytes. To specify units add symbol K or M.
-T timeout Specify timeout for mirror response in seconds. --timeout=timeout Default value is 10 seconds.
-o filename Specify a name of the file data will be saved --out-file=filename to. By default the filename on the server is used. If it's impossible to detect the filename, 'out' will be used.
-u filename Specify the file with links on each line. --urls-file=filename Links from this file will be added to links from command line.
Links should start with protocol http://, https:// or ftp:// and should be splitted with space. If there is argument specifing a file with links in command line, then you may omit links in the command line.

warnings.msg: unable to determine filename on the mirror {}
filename on the server {} differs with {}. Probably that's another file.

errors.msg: unable to connect to the server {}
server {} does not support partial downloading.
size of the file on the server {} {} bytes differs with received before {} bytes.
wrong argument in the command line.
unable to read links file '{}'. File is corrupted.
unable to read links file '{}'. Permission denied.
There are no mirrors to download.

questions.msg: File {} already exists. Do you really want to rewrite that? All data will be lost.
File {} not found. Do you want to start downloading again?
Directory {} does not exist. Do you want to create that?
